summary: The document is a secret cable from May 1976, detailing the activities and associations of William LZ Olthans, a Dutch freelance journalist known for his sensational journalism and homosexual activity. It highlights his leftist views, advocacy for communism in Indonesia, and his alleged intimate relations with prominent Indonesians, including Sukarno. The document also covers his conflicts with NATO Secretary General Josef Luns, his travels to the USSR, and his contacts with Soviet diplomats suspected of being KGB agents. Furthermore, it mentions his claims of acquaintance with notable figures such as columnist Jack Anderson and former US Ambassador to Indonesia Howard Jones.
key_findings: William LZ Olthans was a Dutch freelance journalist with a controversial background, including sensational journalism and homosexual activity.
He held extreme leftist views and believed communism was the best future for Indonesia.
Olthans had alleged intimate relations with prominent Indonesians, including Sukarno.
He was in conflict with NATO Secretary General Josef Luns over policy towards West New Guinea.
Olthans traveled to the USSR and maintained contacts with Soviet diplomats suspected of being KGB agents.
He claimed to know notable figures such as Jack Anderson and Howard Jones.
